documents.document:
What to Consider When Buying New Parts Cleaning Work Holding

When you are buying new parts cleaning machinery or when you are replacing your old work holding systems, there are a few things that you need to consider. The following points will help you to find a work holding system that works well for your parts and your cleaning situation.

One of the first things that you want to consider is what you are cleaning and what you are cleaning off. Of course, if you are cleaning small parts, for example, you do not want a work holding system with holes that are bigger than the parts. This would cause your parts to get lost in the machinery or simply not get cleaned. You also need to consider what you are cleaning off of your parts. Are you cleaning off oil, wax, grease, swarf, etc.? For example, aluminum swarf tends to float in certain solvents, and this characteristic might affect the type of parts cleaning work holding system you need.

In addition to the size of the parts being cleaned, you also want to consider the material (plastic, metal, etc.) and whether metal on metal contact is permissible during the cleaning process.

You also have to consider how much product needs to be cleaned per load. This affects the size of your parts cleaning work holding system. If you are considering ultrasonic cleaning or solvent degreasing, this will affect your choice as well. Finally, you also want to consider the level of cleanliness you need, whether you need spotless or somewhat less dirty than they were originally. Typically, most parts can use a metal basket for cleaning. Instances where this might not be the case include sensitive parts, such as medical equipment.

Where to Buy Parts Cleaning Work Holding

If you are interested in buying parts cleaning work holding systems or you are interested in parts cleaning machinery, you should contact a UK company called Kumi Solutions. This company is well-established, and they strive to work with their customers to help them find the best piece of machinery for their situation.

They have a variety of parts cleaning work holding systems available, and they also have a variety of parts cleaning systems. If your parts cleaning system is out of date, you might want to consider upgrading to a newer, more efficient model. For example, Kumi Solutions offers the Pero R1, which is one of the more efficient parts cleaning machines available. This machine can process a load of parts in three to four minutes, depending on the number of baskets it is processing. It can handle up to 80 kg per load, which means that it can process up to 1000 kg of parts per hour.

Kumi even offers free cleaning demonstrations at their facility in Nuneaton, and this means that you can bring your own parts to see how their machines will clean them-for free. Whether you need a new parts cleaning work holding system or an entirely new parts cleaning system, Kumi Solutions is the place to go.

What to Consider When Buying New Parts Cleaning Work Holding

When you are buying new parts cleaning machinery or when you are replacing your old work holding systems, there are a few things that you need to consider. The following points will help you to find a work holding system that works well for your parts and your cleaning situation.

One of the first things that you want to consider is what you are cleaning and what you are cleaning off. Of course, if you are cleaning small parts, for example, you do not want a work holding system with holes that are bigger than the parts. This would cause your parts to get lost in the machinery or simply not get cleaned. You also need to consider what you are cleaning off of your parts. Are you cleaning off oil, wax, grease, swarf, etc.? For example, aluminum swarf tends to float in certain solvents, and this characteristic might affect the type of parts cleaning work holding system you need.

In addition to the size of the parts being cleaned, you also want to consider the material (plastic, metal, etc.) and whether metal on metal contact is permissible during the cleaning process.

Finally, you also want to consider the level of cleanliness you need, whether you need spotless or somewhat less dirty than they were originally. Typically, most parts can use a metal basket for cleaning. Instances where this might not be the case include sensitive parts, such as medical equipment.
